definitions: informal gathering or party organized for people to meet and interact socially
examples: The church social brought together families from the entire community
Students organized an ice cream social to welcome new freshmen

definitions: activity of spending time with others in friendly situations for enjoyment
examples: Weekend socialising helps maintain important personal and professional relationships
She found socialising difficult after years of working remotely

definitions: political and economic theory advocating collective or governmental ownership of production means
examples: Democratic socialism combines socialist economics with political democracy and civil liberties
The country experimented with socialism during the twentieth century

definitions: person who advocates or practices socialism as an economic and political system
examples: The socialist argued for universal healthcare and education funding
Many socialists believe in democratic participation in economic decisions

definitions: person prominent in fashionable society who attends many social events
examples: The socialite appeared at three charity galas that week
Manhattan socialites dominated the museum's annual fundraising committee

definitions: process by which individuals learn and adopt society's norms, values, and behaviors
act of organizing people or activities into social groups or structures
examples: Early childhood socialization shapes fundamental personality traits and social skills
The puppy needs proper socialization with other dogs and people
Employee socialization programs help new hires understand company culture
Regular socialization activities improve team cohesion and workplace morale

definitions: activity of spending time with others in friendly situations for enjoyment
examples: Weekend socializing helps maintain important personal and professional relationships
She limited her socializing during the busy exam period

definitions: organized community of people living together with shared customs, laws, and institutions
organization formed for particular purpose or activity with formal membership
wealthy and fashionable social class considered prestigious and exclusive
examples: Modern society faces challenges from technology and climate change
Civil society plays crucial roles in democratic governance
The historical society preserves documents from the colonial period
She joined the honor society after achieving academic excellence
High society gatherings required formal attire and proper etiquette
The charity ball attracted members of Philadelphia society

definitions: professional who studies human society, social behavior, and group interactions systematically
examples: The sociologist conducted extensive fieldwork in urban communities
Leading sociologists debate the impact of social media on relationships

definitions: academic discipline studying society, social relationships, institutions, and human group behavior
examples: Sociology examines how social structures influence individual behavior patterns
She majored in sociology with focus on urban development

definitions: person with antisocial personality disorder showing persistent disregard for others' rights
examples: The sociopath manipulated colleagues without showing any genuine remorse
Clinical psychologists identified sociopathic tendencies through behavioral assessment tests

definitions: knitted garment worn on foot inside shoe for warmth and comfort
hard blow or punch delivered with considerable force
examples: His wool socks kept his feet warm during the winter hike
She sorted the laundry looking for matching sock pairs
The boxer delivered a powerful sock to his opponent's jaw
He threatened to sock anyone who insulted his family

definitions: electrical fitting in wall for plugging in appliances and devices
hollow part or device designed to receive and hold something firmly
bony cavity in skull that contains and protects the eyeball
examples: The power socket needed replacement after years of heavy use
She plugged her laptop charger into the wall socket
The mechanic selected the correct socket wrench for the bolt
The ball joint fits perfectly into its socket housing
The impact fractured the bone around his eye socket
Deep-set eye sockets gave him a distinctive appearance

definitions: piece of grass-covered soil held together by matted roots
mildly offensive term for annoying or contemptible person
examples: The landscaper laid fresh sod to create an instant lawn
They ordered several pallets of sod for the golf course
The poor sod lost his job just before the holidays
Stop being such a miserable sod and join the party

definitions: sweet carbonated soft drink containing flavoring and often caffeine
sodium carbonate or bicarbonate used in cleaning and baking
examples: She ordered a cherry soda at the old-fashioned diner
The vending machine offered various sodas and juices
Baking soda helps neutralize odors in the refrigerator effectively
They used washing soda to remove stubborn laundry stains

definitions: soft silver-white metallic element that reacts violently with water, symbol Na
examples: Sodium chloride forms when sodium combines with chlorine atoms
Doctors recommended reducing sodium intake to lower blood pressure

definitions: sexual intercourse involving anal or oral copulation, historically criminalized in many jurisdictions
examples: Laws prohibiting sodomy were ruled unconstitutional by the Supreme Court
Medieval texts condemned sodomy according to religious doctrine

definitions: long upholstered seat with back and arms for multiple people
examples: The leather sofa dominated the living room's seating arrangement
They bought a sectional sofa for their new apartment

definitions: team sport similar to baseball played with larger ball on smaller field
examples: The company softball league plays every Thursday evening downtown
She pitched for her college softball team four years

definitions: process of making something less hard, severe, or intense in nature
examples: The softening of water removes minerals that cause scaling
Market analysts noted a softening in consumer demand recently

definitions: programs and operating information used by computers to perform specific tasks
examples: The company develops accounting software for small business clients
Regular software updates improve security and add new features

definitions: upper layer of earth where plants grow containing organic and mineral matter
territory or country considered as place of origin or residence
examples: Rich soil produces abundant vegetable crops each growing season
The soil test revealed nitrogen deficiency requiring fertilizer supplements
Soldiers defended their native soil against foreign invasion forces
Many immigrants never returned to their home soil again

definitions: temporary stay or visit in a place away from one's usual residence
examples: His sojourn in Paris inspired several paintings and poems
After a brief sojourn abroad, she returned home refreshed

definitions: comfort or consolation during times of distress, disappointment, or sadness
examples: She found solace in music after her mother's death
Religious faith provided solace during their difficult financial situation

definitions: fusible metal alloy used to join metal surfaces together permanently
examples: Lead-free solder meets modern environmental safety standards for electronics
The plumber applied solder to seal the copper pipe joints

definitions: process of joining metal parts using melted solder as permanent bonding agent
examples: Circuit board soldering requires steady hands and proper ventilation
She learned soldering techniques in her electronics repair class

definitions: person serving in army as member of organized armed forces
examples: The soldier completed basic training before overseas deployment began
Wounded soldiers received medical care at the field hospital

definitions: bottom part of shoe or foot that touches the ground
edible marine flatfish with both eyes on one side
single or only one without others of same kind
examples: The rubber sole provided excellent traction on wet surfaces
He needed new soles put on his favorite dress shoes
The chef prepared lemon sole with butter and fresh herbs
Dover sole remains one of the most prized restaurant fish
She was the sole survivor of the plane crash
The sole purpose of the meeting was budget approval

definitions: quality of being serious, dignified, and formal in manner or ceremony
examples: The funeral proceeded with appropriate solemnity and respectful silence
The judge maintained solemnity throughout the sentencing hearing

definitions: act of asking for or trying to obtain something from someone
criminal act of offering services especially prostitution or encouraging illegal activity
examples: The charity's solicitation campaign raised funds for disaster relief
Door-to-door solicitation requires permits in many residential areas
Police arrested him for solicitation near the downtown district
Solicitation of bribes constitutes serious corruption offense

definitions: lawyer who advises clients, prepares legal documents, and represents them in lower courts
examples: The solicitor prepared all necessary documents for the property sale
She consulted her solicitor before signing the employment contract

definitions: matter with definite shape and volume that resists deformation
three-dimensional geometric figure or object with length, width, and height
examples: Water becomes a solid when it freezes into ice
The engineer tested whether the bridge foundation was solid
Students learned to calculate the volume of geometric solids
The cube represents the simplest form of regular solid

definitions: unity of purpose and mutual support within a group sharing common interests
examples: Workers showed solidarity by refusing to cross the picket line
International solidarity helped the independence movement succeed

definitions: quality of being firm, stable, and substantial without weakness or gaps
examples: Engineers tested the solidity of the concrete foundation thoroughly
The argument's solidity convinced even the strongest skeptics present

definitions: dramatic device where character speaks thoughts aloud when alone on stage
examples: Hamlet's famous soliloquy begins with questioning existence itself
The actress delivered the soliloquy with remarkable emotional depth

definitions: card game played by one person with standard deck
single gemstone especially diamond set alone in jewelry piece
examples: She played solitaire on her computer during lunch breaks
Klondike solitaire remains the most popular single-player card game
The engagement ring featured a two-carat solitaire diamond setting
She preferred the simple elegance of a solitaire pendant

definitions: state of being alone especially as punishment in prison isolation
examples: The prisoner spent thirty days in solitary confinement
Solitary can cause severe psychological effects on inmates

definitions: state of being alone often sought for peace, privacy, or reflection
examples: Writers often seek solitude to concentrate on their creative work
The mountain cabin offered perfect solitude for meditation

definitions: musical piece or passage performed by single voice or instrument
activity or action done alone without accompaniment or assistance
examples: The guitarist played an impressive solo during the concert
Her violin solo moved the audience to tears
She completed her first solo flight after months of training
His solo exhibition featured twenty new abstract paintings

definitions: musician or singer who performs alone or featured parts in ensemble
examples: The piano soloist received standing ovation after the concerto
She worked as a soloist with major symphony orchestras

definitions: either of two times yearly when sun reaches maximum or minimum declination
examples: The summer solstice marks the longest day of the year
Ancient cultures celebrated the winter solstice with fire festivals

definitions: answer to problem or method for dealing with difficult situation
liquid mixture where substance is dissolved uniformly in another substance
examples: The engineering team found an elegant solution to the design problem
Negotiation offered the best solution to the labor dispute
The saline solution helps clean and disinfect contact lenses
Scientists prepared a sugar solution for the experiment

definitions: ability to meet long-term financial obligations and continue operating successfully
examples: The bank's solvency came into question during the financial crisis
Regular audits help ensure the company maintains adequate solvency

definitions: liquid substance capable of dissolving other substances to form solutions
state of having enough assets to cover debts and financial obligations
examples: Acetone works as an effective solvent for removing nail polish
The factory must properly dispose of industrial solvents
The business remained solvent despite the economic downturn
Only solvent banks could participate in the merger discussions

definitions: person or thing that finds solutions to problems or puzzles
examples: She gained reputation as an excellent problem solver at work
The crossword solver completed the Sunday puzzle in record time

definitions: act or process of finding answers or solutions to problems
examples: Problem solving requires both analytical and creative thinking skills
The team spent weeks solving the technical challenges

definitions: broad-brimmed Mexican hat with high pointed crown made of straw or felt
examples: Mariachi musicians wore decorated sombreros during the festival performance
The sombrero provided excellent shade from the desert sun

definitions: acrobatic movement where body rotates completely forward or backward overhead
examples: The gymnast executed three somersaults before landing perfectly
Children practiced somersaults on the soft gymnasium mats

definitions: trained wine professional who specializes in wine service and pairing in restaurants
examples: The sommelier recommended a perfect wine pairing for each course
She studied for years to become a certified master sommelier

definitions: male child in relation to either or both parents
examples: Their son graduated from medical school with highest honors
The father taught his son traditional woodworking techniques
